responses.content:
```yaml
leads:
  - headline: Incorrect handling of directory traversal via unsafe template paths
    analysis: |
      The Pandoc template rendering functionality accepts template paths as input, which could enable directory traversal attacks if the paths are not properly sanitized. An attacker could potentially supply a path like `../../../etc/passwd` to read arbitrary files on the server.
    cwe: CWE-22
    function_names:
      - (not available)
    filenames:
      - doc/template.html
    classification: very promising

  - headline: Browser-side script inclusion through unsafe inline script
    analysis: |
      The template contains an inline `<script>` that is executed in the browser context. If user input is allowed to influence the contents of the template, an attacker could potentially inject malicious scripts to perform XSS attacks or other client-side attacks.
    cwe: CWE-79
    function_names:
      - (not available)
    filenames: 
      - doc/template.html
    classification: very promising
```

leads.headline: Incorrect handling of directory traversal via unsafe template paths
leads.analysis: The Pandoc template rendering functionality accepts template paths as input, which could enable directory traversal attacks if the paths are not properly sanitized. An attacker could potentially supply a path like ../../../etc/passwd to read arbitrary files on the server.

leads.headline: Browser-side script inclusion through unsafe inline script
leads.analysis: The template contains an inline <script> that is executed in the browser context. If user input is allowed to influence the contents of the template, an attacker could potentially inject malicious scripts to perform XSS attacks or other client-side attacks.
